trans-unit.source: Specifies that <xref href="System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer"></xref> will not serialize the public property or public field.

If you apply <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.ScriptIgnoreAttribute> to a public property or public field of a class, then <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> ignores, or skips, the member when serializing an instance of the class to JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format.
The <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.ScriptIgnoreAttribute> will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.Script.Services.ScriptMethodAttribute.ResponseFormat%2A> property is set to `Xml`.
If you want to have the same behavior when serializing to XML format, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIgnoreAttribute> should be applied to the property or field instead.
This is because the class will be serialized by using <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> instead of <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer>.
You can also apply both <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.ScriptIgnoreAttribute> and <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIgnoreAttribute> to a property or field.
In this case, the property or field will be ignored for JSON and XML response formats.
For more information about how to use attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Script.Serialization.ScriptIgnoreAttribute"></xref> class.

Gets or set whether to override the <xref href="System.Web.Script.Serialization.ScriptIgnoreAttribute"></xref> so that the <xref href="System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer"></xref> will consider the serialization of the public property or public field.
